summary: The Climate and Health Protection Act (H.R. 1645) aims to amend the Public Health Service Act to ensure the continued implementation of the Climate and Health program within the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The program, carried out by the National Center for Environmental Health, focuses on translating climate science for governmental bodies and communities, creating decision support tools, and leading public health planning for climate impacts. The bill authorizes appropriations of $110,000,000 annually starting in fiscal year 2026. It also mandates congressional notification for any successor program and prohibits fund transfers to other programs.
